Description: This is a 1983 Mako (strat style) from Japan’s Mastumoko factory. That factory turned out higher end Aria guitars as well. The neck is a comfortable “D” profile. Everything is original except the tuners and five way switch. Pickups were replaced with a modern dragon fire set. Other than the sharp headstock This guitar has similar aesthetics as the guitars often played by David Gilmore and the Edge. Serial number: 708324 Body: maple Neck: maple Headstock: pointy / painted Tuners: generic Grover-style Five way selector: genuine fender part About the brand: The line was started by Matsumoku, a ledendary luthier from Japan (hence the name Mako). He mass produced guitars for all the big brands in the early 70s and decided to release his own line. The name was acquired by Kaman (owner of Ovation and Takamini) in the eighties.
Title: 1983 Mako 80’s Strat Style Electric Guitar Black + Maple Neck (made in Japan)
